intro: Descurainia pulcherrima, commonly known as the pretty yellow rocket, is an annual flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its seeds are small and pod-like, containing several angular, tan-colored seeds that are dispersed by wind. Descurainia pulcherrima is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
